      11             : namespace types
      12             : {
      13             : 
      14             :   /* Variant functor is a generic wrapper for functor object, for which we
      15             :    *don't know a priori the common signature,
      16             :    * because of of the variadic operator().
      17             :    *
      18             :    * The trick is to allocate a piece of memory large enough to hold any of
      19             :    *the functor, then maintain, for each functor type, a pointer to that type.
      20             :    * There can be only one pointer for each variadic set to a non null value
      21             :    *(based on the preallocated memory buffer).
      22             :    *
      23             :    * When calling the functor operator(), the code iterates (linearly) on each
      24             :    *pointer && call the operator() of this pointer.
      25             :    */
      26             : 
      27             :   template <class... Types>
      28             :   struct variant_functor;
      29             : 
      30             :   namespace details
      31             :   {
      32             :

      38             :       Type *fun = nullptr;
